entry.title: Head in the clouds
entry.content: When I first moved from my Operations role into DevOps the first thing I started to learn was AWS (Amazon Web Services). The team I had moved into were hosting everything in AWS, using Terraform, for Infrastructure as code, GoCD, for Pipelines, ECS and Docker, for containers, and more...all of which I'll write more about later. I found AWS enjoyable to learn and easy to become familiar with. The portal is clear, for most tasks, and the cli is straight forward and allows for tasks to be completed at speed.
entry.summary: When I first moved from my Operations role into DevOps the first thing I started to learn was AWS (Amazon Web Services). The team I had moved into were hosting everything in AWS, using Terraform, for Infrastructure as code, GoCD, for Pipelines, ECS and Docker, for containers, and more...all of which I'll write more about later. I found AWS enjoyable to learn and easy to become familiar with. The portal is clear, for most tasks, and the cli is straight forward and allows for tasks to be completed at speed.
